Register.name: CONSET
Register.description: I2C Control Set Register. When a one is written to a bit of this register, the corresponding bit in the I2C control register is set. Writing a zero has no effect on the corresponding bit in the I2C control register.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: AA
BitField.description: Assert acknowledge flag.

BitField.name: SI
BitField.description: I2C interrupt flag.

BitField.name: STO
BitField.description: STOP flag.

BitField.name: STA
BitField.description: START flag.

BitField.name: I2EN
BitField.description: I2C interface enable.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: STAT
Register.description: I2C Status Register. During I2C operation, this register provides detailed status codes that allow software to determine the next action needed.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: These bits are unused and are always 0.

BitField.name: Status
BitField.description: These bits give the actual status information about the I 2C interface.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: DAT
Register.description: I2C Data Register. During master or slave transmit mode, data to be transmitted is written to this register. During master or slave receive mode, data that has been received may be read from this register.

BitField.name: Data
BitField.description: This register holds data values that have been received or are to be transmitted.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: ADR0
Register.description: I2C Slave Address Register 0. Contains the 7-bit slave address for operation of the I2C interface in slave mode, and is not used in master mode. The least significant bit determines whether a slave responds to the General Call address.

BitField.name: GC
BitField.description: General Call enable bit.

BitField.name: Address
BitField.description: The I2C device address for slave mode.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: SCLH
Register.description: SCH Duty Cycle Register High Half Word. Determines the high time of the I2C clock.

BitField.name: SCLH
BitField.description: Count for SCL HIGH time period selection.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: SCLL
Register.description: SCL Duty Cycle Register Low Half Word. Determines the low time of the I2C clock. I2nSCLL and I2nSCLH together determine the clock frequency generated by an I2C master and certain times used in slave mode.

BitField.name: SCLL
BitField.description: Count for SCL low time period selection.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: CONCLR
Register.description: I2C Control Clear Register. When a one is written to a bit of this register, the corresponding bit in the I2C control register is cleared. Writing a zero has no effect on the corresponding bit in the I2C control register.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: AAC
BitField.description: Assert acknowledge Clear bit.

BitField.name: SIC
BitField.description: I2C interrupt Clear bit.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: STAC
BitField.description: START flag Clear bit.

BitField.name: I2ENC
BitField.description: I2C interface Disable bit.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: MMCTRL
Register.description: Monitor mode control register.

BitField.name: MM_ENA
BitField.description: Monitor mode enable.

Enum.name: THE_I2C_MODULE_WILL_
Enum.description: The I2C module will enter monitor mode. In this mode the SDA output will be forced high. This will prevent the I2C module from outputting data of any kind (including ACK) onto the I 2C data bus. Depending on the state of the ENA_SCL bit, the output may be also forced high, preventing the module from having control over the I2C clock line.

BitField.name: ENA_SCL
BitField.description: SCL output enable.

Enum.name: HIGH
Enum.description: When this bit is cleared to 0, the SCL output will be forced high when the module is in monitor mode. As described above, this will prevent the module from having any control over the I2C clock line.

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: When this bit is set, the I2C module may exercise the same control over the clock line that it would in normal operation. This means that, acting as a slave peripheral, the I2C module can stretch the clock line (hold it low) until it has had time to respond to an I2C interrupt.[1]

BitField.name: MATCH_ALL
BitField.description: Select interrupt register match.

Enum.name: MATCH
Enum.description: When this bit is cleared, an interrupt will only be generated when a match occurs to one of the (up-to) four address registers described above. That is, the module will respond as a normal slave as far as address-recognition is concerned.

Enum.name: ANYADDRESS
Enum.description: When this bit is set to 1 and the I2C is in monitor mode, an interrupt will be generated on ANY address received. This will enable the part to monitor all traffic on the bus.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from reserved bits is not defined.

Register.name: ADR1
Register.description: I2C Slave Address Register 1. Contains the 7-bit slave address for operation of the I2C interface in slave mode, and is not used in master mode. The least significant bit determines whether a slave responds to the General Call address.

BitField.name: GC
BitField.description: General Call enable bit.

BitField.name: Address
BitField.description: The I2C device address for slave mode.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.description: I2C Slave Address Register 1. Contains the 7-bit slave address for operation of the I2C interface in slave mode, and is not used in master mode. The least significant bit determines whether a slave responds to the General Call address.

BitField.name: Address
BitField.description: The I2C device address for slave mode.

Register.description: I2C Slave Address Register 1. Contains the 7-bit slave address for operation of the I2C interface in slave mode, and is not used in master mode. The least significant bit determines whether a slave responds to the General Call address.

BitField.name: Address

Register.description: Data buffer register. The contents of the 8 MSBs of the I2DAT shift register will be transferred to the DATA_BUFFER automatically after every nine bits (8 bits of data plus ACK or NACK) has been received on the bus.

BitField.name: Data

Register.description: I2C Slave address mask register 0. This mask register is associated with I2ADR0 to determine an address match. The mask register has no effect when comparing to the General Call address (0000000).

Register.description: I2C Slave address mask register 0. This mask register is associated with I2ADR0 to determine an address match. The mask register has no effect when comparing to the General Call address (0000000).

BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. This bit reads always back as 0.

BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. This bit reads always back as 0.

RegisterGroup.name: WWDT
RegisterGroup.description: Product name title=UM10398 Chapter title=LPC111x/LPC11Cxx Windowed WatchDog Timer (WDT) Modification date=9/19/2011 Major revision=6 Minor revision=not available

Register.name: WDMOD
Register.description: Watchdog mode register. This register contains the basic mode and status of the Watchdog Timer.

BitField.name: WDEN
BitField.description: Watchdog enable bit. This bit is Set Only. Setting this bit to one also locks the watchdog clock source. Once the watchdog timer is enabled, the watchdog timer clock source cannot be changed. If the watchdog timer is needed in Deep-sleep mode, the watchdog clock source must be changed to the watchdog oscillator before setting this bit to one.

BitField.name: WDRESET
BitField.description: Watchdog reset enable bit. This bit is Set Only.

Enum.name: NORESET
Enum.description: A watchdog timeout will not cause a chip reset.

Enum.name: RESET
Enum.description: A watchdog timeout will cause a chip reset.

BitField.name: WDTOF
BitField.description: Watchdog time-out flag. Set when the watchdog timer times out, by a feed error, or by events associated with WDPROTECT, cleared by software. Causes a chip reset if WDRESET = 1.

BitField.name: WDINT
BitField.description: Watchdog interrupt flag. Set when the timer reaches the value in WDWARNINT. Cleared by software.

BitField.name: WDPROTECT
BitField.description: Watchdog update mode. This bit is Set Only.

Enum.name: ANYTIME
Enum.description: The watchdog reload value (WDTC) can be changed at any time.

Enum.name: LOWCOUNTER
Enum.description: The watchdog reload value (WDTC) can be changed only after the counter is below the value of WDWARNINT and WDWINDOW. Note: this mode is intended for use only when WDRESET =1.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: WDTC
Register.description: Watchdog timer constant register. This register determines the time-out value.

BitField.name: Count
BitField.description: Watchdog time-out interval.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: WDFEED
Register.description: Watchdog feed sequence register. Writing 0xAA followed by 0x55 to this register reloads the Watchdog timer with the value contained in WDTC.

BitField.name: Feed
BitField.description: Feed value should be 0xAA followed by 0x55.

Register.name: WDTV
Register.description: Watchdog timer value register. This register reads out the current value of the Watchdog timer.

BitField.name: Count
BitField.description: Counter timer value.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: WDWARNINT
Register.description: Watchdog Warning Interrupt compare value.

BitField.name: WARNINT
BitField.description: Watchdog warning interrupt compare value.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: WDWINDOW
Register.description: Watchdog Window compare value.

BitField.name: WINDOW
BitField.description: Watchdog window value.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

RegisterGroup.name: UART
RegisterGroup.description: Product name title=UM10398 Chapter title=LPC111x/LPC11Cxx UART Modification date=9/19/2011 Major revision=7 Minor revision=not available

Register.name: RBR
Register.description: Receiver Buffer Register. Contains the next received character to be read. (DLAB=0)

BitField.name: RBR
BitField.description: The UART Receiver Buffer Register contains the oldest received byte in the UART RX FIFO.

Register.name: THR
Register.description: Transmit Holding Register. The next character to be transmitted is written here. (DLAB=0)

BitField.name: THR
BitField.description: Writing to the UART Transmit Holding Register causes the data to be stored in the UART transmit FIFO. The byte will be sent when it reaches the bottom of the FIFO and the transmitter is available.

Register.name: DLL
Register.description: Divisor Latch LSB. Least significant byte of the baud rate divisor value. The full divisor is used to generate a baud rate from the fractional rate divider. (DLAB=1)

BitField.name: DLLSB
BitField.description: The UART Divisor Latch LSB Register, along with the DLM register, determines the baud rate of the UART.

Register.name: DLM
Register.description: Divisor Latch MSB. Most significant byte of the baud rate divisor value. The full divisor is used to generate a baud rate from the fractional rate divider. (DLAB=1)

BitField.name: DLMSB
BitField.description: The UART Divisor Latch MSB Register, along with the DLL register, determines the baud rate of the UART.

Register.name: IER
Register.description: Interrupt Enable Register. Contains individual interrupt enable bits for the 7 potential UART interrupts. (DLAB=0)

BitField.name: RBRIE
BitField.description: RBR Interrupt Enable. Enables the Receive Data Available interrupt for UART. It also controls the Character Receive Time-out interrupt.

BitField.name: THREIE
BitField.description: THRE Interrupt Enable. Enables the THRE interrupt for UART. The status of this interrupt can be read from LSR[5].

BitField.name: RXLIE
BitField.description: RX Line Interrupt Enable. Enables the UART RX line status interrupts. The status of this interrupt can be read from LSR[4:1].

Enum.name: DISABLE_THE_RX_LINE_
Enum.description: Disable the RX line status interrupts.

Enum.name: ENABLE_THE_RX_LINE_S
Enum.description: Enable the RX line status interrupts.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: ABEOINTEN
BitField.description: Enables the end of auto-baud interrupt.

BitField.name: ABTOINTEN
BitField.description: Enables the auto-baud time-out interrupt.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: IIR
Register.description: Interrupt ID Register. Identifies which interrupt(s) are pending.

BitField.name: INTSTATUS
BitField.description: Interrupt status. Note that IIR[0] is active low. The pending interrupt can be determined by evaluating IIR[3:1].

Enum.name: PENDING
Enum.description: At least one interrupt is pending.

BitField.name: INTID
BitField.description: Interrupt identification. IER[3:1] identifies an interrupt corresponding to the UART Rx FIFO. All other combinations of IER[3:1] not listed below are reserved (100,101,111).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: FIFOENABLE
BitField.description: These bits are equivalent to FCR[0].

BitField.name: ABEOINT
BitField.description: End of auto-baud interrupt. True if auto-baud has finished successfully and interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: ABTOINT
BitField.description: Auto-baud time-out interrupt. True if auto-baud has timed out and interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: FCR
Register.description: FIFO Control Register. Controls UART FIFO usage and modes.

BitField.name: FIFOEN
BitField.description: FIFO Enable

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: UART FIFOs are disabled. Must not be used in the application.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Active high enable for both UART Rx and TX FIFOs and FCR[7:1] access. This bit must be set for proper UART operation. Any transition on this bit will automatically clear the UART FIFOs.

BitField.name: RXFIFORES
BitField.description: RX FIFO Reset

Enum.name: NO_IMPACT_ON_EITHER_
Enum.description: No impact on either of UART FIFOs.

Enum.name: CLEAR
Enum.description: Writing a logic 1 to FCR[1] will clear all bytes in UART Rx FIFO, reset the pointer logic. This bit is self-clearing.

BitField.name: TXFIFORES
BitField.description: TX FIFO Reset

Enum.name: NO_IMPACT_ON_EITHER_
Enum.description: No impact on either of UART FIFOs.

Enum.name: CLEAR
Enum.description: Writing a logic 1 to FCR[2] will clear all bytes in UART TX FIFO, reset the pointer logic. This bit is self-clearing.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RXTL
BitField.description: RX Trigger Level. These two bits determine how many receiver UART FIFO characters must be written before an interrupt is activated.

Register.name: LCR
Register.description: Line Control Register. Contains controls for frame formatting and break generation.

BitField.name: WLS
BitField.description: Word Length Select

BitField.name: SBS
BitField.description: Stop Bit Select

BitField.name: PE
BitField.description: Parity Enable

BitField.name: PS
BitField.description: Parity Select

Enum.name: ODD_PARITY_NUMBER_O
Enum.description: Odd parity. Number of 1s in the transmitted character and the attached parity bit will be odd.

Enum.name: EVEN_PARITY_NUMBER_
Enum.description: Even Parity. Number of 1s in the transmitted character and the attached parity bit will be even.

BitField.name: BC
BitField.description: Break Control

Enum.name: ENABLE_BREAK_TRANSMI
Enum.description: Enable break transmission. Output pin UART TXD is forced to logic 0 when LCR[6] is active high.

BitField.name: DLAB
BitField.description: Divisor Latch Access Bit

Register.name: MCR
Register.description: Modem control register

BitField.name: DTRC
BitField.description: DTR Control. Source for modem output pin, DTR. This bit reads as 0 when modem loopback mode is active.

BitField.name: RTSC
BitField.description: RTS Control. Source for modem output pin RTS. This bit reads as 0 when modem loopback mode is active.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: LMS
BitField.description: Loopback Mode Select. The modem loopback mode provides a mechanism to perform diagnostic loopback testing. Serial data from the transmitter is connected internally to serial input of the receiver. Input pin, RXD, has no effect on loopback and output pin, TXD is held in marking state. The four modem inputs (CTS, DSR, RI and DCD) are disconnected externally. Externally, the modem outputs (RTS, DTR) are set inactive. Internally, the four modem outputs are connected to the four modem inputs. As a result of these connections, the upper four bits of the MSR will be driven by the lower four bits of the MCR rather than the four modem inputs in normal mode. This permits modem status interrupts to be generated in loopback mode by writing the lower four bits of MCR.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RTSEN
BitField.description: RTS flow control

BitField.name: CTSEN
BitField.description: CTS flow control

Register.name: LSR
Register.description: Line Status Register. Contains flags for transmit and receive status, including line errors.

BitField.name: RDR
BitField.description: Receiver Data Ready. LSR[0] is set when the RBR holds an unread character and is cleared when the UART RBR FIFO is empty.

BitField.name: OE
BitField.description: Overrun Error. The overrun error condition is set as soon as it occurs. A LSR read clears LSR[1]. LSR[1] is set when UART RSR has a new character assembled and the UART RBR FIFO is full. In this case, the UART RBR FIFO will not be overwritten and the character in the UART RSR will be lost.

BitField.name: PE
BitField.description: Parity Error. When the parity bit of a received character is in the wrong state, a parity error occurs. A LSR read clears LSR[2]. Time of parity error detection is dependent on FCR[0]. Note: A parity error is associated with the character at the top of the UART RBR FIFO.

BitField.name: FE
BitField.description: Framing Error. When the stop bit of a received character is a logic 0, a framing error occurs. A LSR read clears LSR[3]. The time of the framing error detection is dependent on FCR0. Upon detection of a framing error, the RX will attempt to re-synchronize to the data and assume that the bad stop bit is actually an early start bit. However, it cannot be assumed that the next received byte will be correct even if there is no Framing Error. Note: A framing error is associated with the character at the top of the UART RBR FIFO.

BitField.name: BI
BitField.description: Break Interrupt. When RXD1 is held in the spacing state (all zeros) for one full character transmission (start, data, parity, stop), a break interrupt occurs. Once the break condition has been detected, the receiver goes idle until RXD1 goes to marking state (all ones). A LSR read clears this status bit. The time of break detection is dependent on FCR[0]. Note: The break interrupt is associated with the character at the top of the UART RBR FIFO.

BitField.name: THRE
BitField.description: Transmitter Holding Register Empty. THRE is set immediately upon detection of an empty UART THR and is cleared on a THR write.

BitField.name: TEMT
BitField.description: Transmitter Empty. TEMT is set when both THR and TSR are empty; TEMT is cleared when either the TSR or the THR contain valid data.

Enum.name: VALID
Enum.description: THR and/or the TSR contains valid data.

Enum.name: EMPTY_
Enum.description: THR and the TSR are empty.

BitField.name: RXFE
BitField.description: Error in RX FIFO. LSR[7] is set when a character with a RX error such as framing error, parity error or break interrupt, is loaded into the RBR. This bit is cleared when the LSR register is read and there are no subsequent errors in the UART FIFO.

Enum.name: NOERROR
Enum.description: RBR contains no UART RX errors or FCR[0]=0.

Enum.name: ERROR
Enum.description: UART RBR contains at least one UART RX error.

Register.name: MSR
Register.description: Modem status register

BitField.name: DCTS
BitField.description: Delta CTS. Set upon state change of input CTS. Cleared on a MSR read.

Enum.name: NO_CHANGE_DETECTED_O
Enum.description: No change detected on modem input CTS.

Enum.name: STATE_CHANGE_DETECTE
Enum.description: State change detected on modem input CTS.

BitField.name: DDSR
BitField.description: Delta DSR. Set upon state change of input DSR. Cleared on a MSR read.

Enum.name: NO_CHANGE_DETECTED_O
Enum.description: No change detected on modem input DSR.

Enum.name: STATE_CHANGE_DETECTE
Enum.description: State change detected on modem input DSR.

BitField.name: TERI
BitField.description: Trailing Edge RI. Set upon low to high transition of input RI. Cleared on a MSR read.

Enum.name: NO_CHANGE_DETECTED_O
Enum.description: No change detected on modem input, RI.

BitField.name: DDCD
BitField.description: Delta DCD. Set upon state change of input DCD. Cleared on a MSR read.

Enum.name: NO_CHANGE_DETECTED_O
Enum.description: No change detected on modem input DCD.

Enum.name: STATE_CHANGE_DETECTE
Enum.description: State change detected on modem input DCD.

BitField.name: CTS
BitField.description: Clear To Send State. Complement of input signal CTS. This bit is connected to MCR[1] in modem loopback mode.

BitField.name: DSR
BitField.description: Data Set Ready State. Complement of input signal DSR. This bit is connected to MCR[0] in modem loopback mode.

BitField.name: RI
BitField.description: Ring Indicator State. Complement of input RI. This bit is connected to MCR[2] in modem loopback mode.

BitField.name: DCD
BitField.description: Data Carrier Detect State. Complement of input DCD. This bit is connected to MCR[3] in modem loopback mode.

Register.name: SCR
Register.description: Scratch Pad Register. Eight-bit temporary storage for software.

BitField.name: pad
BitField.description: A readable, writable byte.

Register.name: ACR
Register.description: Auto-baud Control Register. Contains controls for the auto-baud feature.

BitField.name: START
BitField.description: Start bit. This bit is automatically cleared after auto-baud completion.

Enum.name: START
Enum.description: Auto-baud start (auto-baud is running). Auto-baud run bit. This bit is automatically cleared after auto-baud completion.

BitField.name: MODE
BitField.description: Auto-baud mode select

BitField.name: AUTORESTART
BitField.description: Restart enable

Enum.name: RESTART_IN_CASE_OF_T
Enum.description: Restart in case of time-out (counter restarts at next UART Rx falling edge)

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: ABEOINTCLR
BitField.description: End of auto-baud interrupt clear (write only accessible)

Enum.name: CLEAR
Enum.description: Writing a 1 will clear the corresponding interrupt in the IIR.

BitField.name: ABTOINTCLR
BitField.description: Auto-baud time-out interrupt clear (write only accessible)

Enum.name: CLEAR
Enum.description: Writing a 1 will clear the corresponding interrupt in the IIR.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: FDR
Register.description: Fractional Divider Register. Generates a clock input for the baud rate divider.

BitField.name: DIVADDVAL
BitField.description: Baud rate generation pre-scaler divisor value. If this field is 0, fractional baud rate generator will not impact the UART baud rate.

BitField.name: MULVAL
BitField.description: Baud rate pre-scaler multiplier value. This field must be greater or equal 1 for UART to operate properly, regardless of whether the fractional baud rate generator is used or not.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: TER
Register.description: Transmit Enable Register. Turns off UART transmitter for use with software flow control.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: TXEN
BitField.description: When this bit is 1, as it is after a Reset, data written to the THR is output on the TXD pin as soon as any preceding data has been sent. If this bit cleared to 0 while a character is being sent, the transmission of that character is completed, but no further characters are sent until this bit is set again. In other words, a 0 in this bit blocks the transfer of characters from the THR or TX FIFO into the transmit shift register. Software can clear this bit when it detects that the a hardware-handshaking TX-permit signal (CTS) has gone false, or with software handshaking, when it receives an XOFF character (DC3). Software can set this bit again when it detects that the TX-permit signal has gone true, or when it receives an XON (DC1) character.

Register.name: RS485CTRL
Register.description: RS-485/EIA-485 Control. Contains controls to configure various aspects of RS-485/EIA-485 modes.

BitField.name: NMMEN
BitField.description: NMM enable.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: RS-485/EIA-485 Normal Multidrop Mode (NMM) is disabled.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: RS-485/EIA-485 Normal Multidrop Mode (NMM) is enabled. In this mode, an address is detected when a received byte causes the UART to set the parity error and generate an interrupt.

BitField.name: RXDIS
BitField.description: Receiver enable.

BitField.name: AADEN
BitField.description: AAD enable.

BitField.name: SEL
BitField.description: Select direction control pin

Enum.name: RTS
Enum.description: If direction control is enabled (bit DCTRL = 1), pin RTS is used for direction control.

Enum.name: DTR
Enum.description: If direction control is enabled (bit DCTRL = 1), pin DTR is used for direction control.

BitField.name: DCTRL
BitField.description: Auto direction control enable.

BitField.name: OINV
BitField.description: Polarity control. This bit reverses the polarity of the direction control signal on the RTS (or DTR) pin.

Enum.name: LOW
Enum.description: The direction control pin will be driven to logic 0 when the transmitter has data to be sent. It will be driven to logic 1 after the last bit of data has been transmitted.

Enum.name: HIGH
Enum.description: The direction control pin will be driven to logic 1 when the transmitter has data to be sent. It will be driven to logic 0 after the last bit of data has been transmitted.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: RS485ADRMATCH
Register.description: RS-485/EIA-485 address match. Contains the address match value for RS-485/EIA-485 mode.

BitField.name: ADRMATCH
BitField.description: Contains the address match value.

Register.name: RS485DLY
Register.description: RS-485/EIA-485 direction control delay.

BitField.name: DLY
BitField.description: Contains the direction control (RTS or DTR) delay value. This register works in conjunction with an 8-bit counter.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: TCR
Register.description: Timer Control Register (TCR). The TCR is used to control the Timer Counter functions. The Timer Counter can be disabled or reset through the TCR.

BitField.name: CEN
BitField.description: Counter Enable. When one, the Timer Counter and Prescale Counter are enabled for counting. When zero, the counters are disabled.

BitField.name: CRST
BitField.description: Counter Reset. When one, the Timer Counter and the Prescale Counter are synchronously reset on the next positive edge of PCLK. The counters remain reset until TCR[1] is returned to zero.

BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: PR
Register.description: Prescale Register (PR). When the Prescale Counter (below) is equal to this value, the next clock increments the TC and clears the PC.

BitField.name: PR
BitField.description: Prescale max value.

Register.name: PC
Register.description: Prescale Counter (PC). The 16-bit PC is a counter which is incremented to the value stored in PR. When the value in PR is reached, the TC is incremented and the PC is cleared. The PC is observable and controllable through the bus interface.

BitField.name: PC
BitField.description: Prescale counter value.

BitField.name: MR0S

Register.name: EMR
Register.description: External Match Register (EMR). The EMR controls the match function and the external match pins CT16B0_MAT[2:0].

BitField.name: EM0
BitField.description: External Match 0. This bit reflects the state of output CT16B0_MAT0/CT16B1_MAT0, whether or not this output is connected to its pin. When a match occurs between the TC and MR0, this bit can either toggle, go LOW, go HIGH, or do nothing. Bits EMR[5:4] control the functionality of this output. This bit is driven to the CT16B0_MAT0/CT16B1_MAT0 pins if the match function is selected in the IOCON registers (0 = LOW, 1 = HIGH).

BitField.name: EM1
BitField.description: External Match 1. This bit reflects the state of output CT16B0_MAT1/CT16B1_MAT1, whether or not this output is connected to its pin. When a match occurs between the TC and MR1, this bit can either toggle, go LOW, go HIGH, or do nothing. Bits EMR[7:6] control the functionality of this output. This bit is driven to the CT16B0_MAT1/CT16B1_MAT1 pins if the match function is selected in the IOCON registers (0 = LOW, 1 = HIGH).

BitField.name: EM2
BitField.description: External Match 2. This bit reflects the state of output match channel 2, whether or not this output is connected to its pin. When a match occurs between the TC and MR2, this bit can either toggle, go LOW, go HIGH, or do nothing. Bits EMR[9:8] control the functionality of this output. Note that on counter/timer 0 this match channel is not pinned out. This bit is driven to the CT16B1_MAT2 pin if the match function is selected in the IOCON registers (0 = LOW, 1 = HIGH).

BitField.name: EM3
BitField.description: External Match 3. This bit reflects the state of output of match channel 3. When a match occurs between the TC and MR3, this bit can either toggle, go LOW, go HIGH, or do nothing. Bits EMR[11:10] control the functionality of this output. There is no output pin available for this channel on either of the 16-bit timers.

BitField.name: EMC0
BitField.description: External Match Control 0. Determines the functionality of External Match 0.

Enum.name: CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND
Enum.description: Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (CT16Bn_MATm pin is LOW if pinned out).

Enum.name: SET_THE_CORRESPONDIN
Enum.description: Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (CT16Bn_MATm pin is HIGH if pinned out).

Enum.name: TOGGLE_THE_CORRESPON
Enum.description: Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

Register.name: CTCR
Register.description: Count Control Register (CTCR). The CTCR selects between Timer and Counter mode, and in Counter mode selects the signal and edge(s) for counting.

BitField.name: CTM
BitField.description: Counter/Timer Mode. This field selects which rising PCLK edges can increment Timer's Prescale Counter (PC), or clear PC and increment Timer Counter (TC).

Enum.name: TIMER_MODE_EVERY_RI
Enum.description: Timer Mode: every rising PCLK edge

Enum.name: COUNTER_MODE_TC_IS_
Enum.description: Counter Mode: TC is incremented on rising edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

Enum.name: COUNTER_MODE_TC_IS_
Enum.description: Counter Mode: TC is incremented on falling edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

Enum.name: COUNTER_MODE_TC_IS_
Enum.description: Counter Mode: TC is incremented on both edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

BitField.name: CIS
BitField.description: Count Input Select. In counter mode (when bits 1:0 in this register are not 00), these bits select which CAP pin is sampled for clocking. Note: If Counter mode is selected in the CTCR register, bits 2:0 in the Capture Control Register (CCR) must be programmed as 000.

BitField.name: ENCC
BitField.description: Setting this bit to one enables clearing of the timer and the prescaler when the capture-edge event specified in bits 7:5 occurs.

BitField.name: SELCC
BitField.description: When bit 4 is one, these bits select which capture input edge will cause the timer and prescaler to be cleared. These bits have no effect when bit 4 is zero.

Enum.name: RISING_EDGE_OF_CAP0_
Enum.description: Rising Edge of CAP0 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set).

Enum.name: FALLING_EDGE_OF_CAP0
Enum.description: Falling Edge of CAP0 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set).

Enum.name: RISING_EDGE_OF_CAP1_
Enum.description: Rising Edge of CAP1 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set).

Enum.name: FALLING_EDGE_OF_CAP1
Enum.description: Falling Edge of CAP1 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: PWMC
Register.description: PWM Control Register (PWMCON). The PWMCON enables PWM mode for the external match pins CT16B0_MAT[2:0].

BitField.name: PWMEN0
BitField.description: PWM channel0 enable

Enum.name: PWM_MODE_IS_ENABLED_
Enum.description: PWM mode is enabled for CT16Bn_MAT0.

BitField.name: PWMEN1
BitField.description: PWM channel1 enable

Enum.name: PWM_MODE_IS_ENABLED_
Enum.description: PWM mode is enabled for CT16Bn_MAT1.

BitField.name: PWMEN2
BitField.description: PWM channel2 enable

Enum.name: MATCH_CHANNEL_2_OR_P
Enum.description: Match channel 2 or pin CT16B0_MAT2 is controlled by EM2. Match channel 2 is not pinned out on timer 1.

Enum.name: PWM_MODE_IS_ENABLED_
Enum.description: PWM mode is enabled for match channel 2 or pin CT16B0_MAT2.

BitField.name: PWMEN3
BitField.description: PWM channel3 enable Note: It is recommended to use match channel 3 to set the PWM cycle because it is not pinned out.

Enum.name: MATCH_CHANNEL_3_MATC
Enum.description: Match channel 3 match channel 3 is controlled by EM3.

Enum.name: PWM_MODE_IS_ENABLED_
Enum.description: PWM mode is enabled for match channel 3match channel 3.

BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Enum.name: TOGGLE_THE_CORRESPON
Enum.description: Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

BitField.name: EMC3
BitField.description: External Match Control 3. Determines the functionality of External Match 3.

Enum.name: CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND
Enum.description: Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (CT16Bn_MATm pin is LOW if pinned out).

Enum.name: SET_THE_CORRESPONDIN
Enum.description: Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (CT16Bn_MATm pin is HIGH if pinned out).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: CTCR
Register.description: Count Control Register (CTCR). The CTCR selects between Timer and Counter mode, and in Counter mode selects the signal and edge(s) for counting.

BitField.name: CTM
BitField.description: Counter/Timer Mode. This field selects which rising PCLK edges can increment Timer's Prescale Counter (PC), or clear PC and increment Timer Counter (TC).

Enum.name: TIMER_MODE_EVERY_RI
Enum.description: Timer Mode: every rising PCLK edge

Enum.name: COUNTER_MODE_TC_IS_
Enum.description: Counter Mode: TC is incremented on rising edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

Enum.name: COUNTER_MODE_TC_IS_
Enum.description: Counter Mode: TC is incremented on falling edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

Enum.name: COUNTER_MODE_TC_IS_
Enum.description: Counter Mode: TC is incremented on both edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

BitField.name: CIS
BitField.description: Count Input Select. In counter mode (when bits 1:0 in this register are not 00), these bits select which CAP pin is sampled for clocking. Note: If Counter mode is selected in the CTCR register, bits 2:0 in the Capture Control Register (CCR) must be programmed as 000.

BitField.name: ENCC
BitField.description: Setting this bit to one enables clearing of the timer and the prescaler when the capture-edge event specified in bits 7:5 occurs.

BitField.name: SELCC
BitField.description: When bit 4 is one, these bits select which capture input edge will cause the timer and prescaler to be cleared. These bits have no effect when bit 4 is zero.

Enum.name: RISING_EDGE_OF_CAP0_
Enum.description: Rising Edge of CAP0 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set).

Enum.name: FALLING_EDGE_OF_CAP0
Enum.description: Falling Edge of CAP0 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set).

Enum.name: RISING_EDGE_OF_CAP1_
Enum.description: Rising Edge of CAP1 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set).

Enum.name: FALLING_EDGE_OF_CAP1
Enum.description: Falling Edge of CAP1 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: PWMC
Register.description: PWM Control Register (PWMCON). The PWMCON enables PWM mode for the external match pins CT16B0_MAT[2:0].

BitField.name: PWMEN0
BitField.description: PWM channel0 enable

Enum.name: PWM_MODE_IS_ENABLED_
Enum.description: PWM mode is enabled for CT16Bn_MAT0.

BitField.name: PWMEN1
BitField.description: PWM channel1 enable

Enum.name: PWM_MODE_IS_ENABLED_
Enum.description: PWM mode is enabled for CT16Bn_MAT1.

BitField.name: PWMEN2
BitField.description: PWM channel2 enable

Enum.name: MATCH_CHANNEL_2_OR_P
Enum.description: Match channel 2 or pin CT16B0_MAT2 is controlled by EM2. Match channel 2 is not pinned out on timer 1.

Enum.name: PWM_MODE_IS_ENABLED_
Enum.description: PWM mode is enabled for match channel 2 or pin CT16B0_MAT2.

BitField.name: PWMEN3
BitField.description: PWM channel3 enable Note: It is recommended to use match channel 3 to set the PWM cycle because it is not pinned out.

Enum.name: MATCH_CHANNEL_3_MATC
Enum.description: Match channel 3 match channel 3 is controlled by EM3.

Enum.name: PWM_MODE_IS_ENABLED_
Enum.description: PWM mode is enabled for match channel 3match channel 3.

BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: IR
Register.description: Interrupt Register (IR). The IR can be written to clear interrupts. The IR can be read to identify which of five possible interrupt sources are pending.

BitField.name: MR0INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for match channel 0.

BitField.name: MR1INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for match channel 1.

BitField.name: MR2INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for match channel 2.

BitField.name: MR3INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for match channel 3.

BitField.name: CR0INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for capture channel 0 event.

BitField.name: CR1INT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag for capture channel 1 event.

Register.name: TCR
Register.description: Timer Control Register (TCR). The TCR is used to control the Timer Counter functions. The Timer Counter can be disabled or reset through the TCR.

BitField.name: CEN
BitField.description: When one, the Timer Counter and Prescale Counter are enabled for counting. When zero, the counters are disabled.

BitField.name: CRST
BitField.description: When one, the Timer Counter and the Prescale Counter are synchronously reset on the next positive edge of PCLK. The counters remain reset until TCR[1] is returned to zero.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: TC
Register.description: Timer Counter (TC). The 32-bit TC is incremented every PR+1 cycles of PCLK. The TC is controlled through the TCR.

BitField.name: TC
BitField.description: Timer counter value.

Register.name: PR
Register.description: Prescale Register (PR). When the Prescale Counter (below) is equal to this value, the next clock increments the TC and clears the PC.

BitField.name: PR
BitField.description: Prescale value.

Register.name: PC
Register.description: Prescale Counter (PC). The 32-bit PC is a counter which is incremented to the value stored in PR. When the value in PR is reached, the TC is incremented and the PC is cleared. The PC is observable and controllable through the bus interface.

BitField.name: PC
BitField.description: Prescale counter value.

Register.name: MCR
Register.description: Match Control Register (MCR). The MCR is used to control if an interrupt is generated and if the TC is reset when a Match occurs.

BitField.name: MR0I
BitField.description: Interrupt on MR0: an interrupt is generated when MR0 matches the value in the TC.

BitField.name: MR0R
BitField.description: Reset on MR0: the TC will be reset if MR0 matches it.

BitField.name: MR0S
BitField.description: Stop on MR0: the TC and PC will be stopped and TCR[0] will be set to 0 if MR0 matches the TC.

BitField.name: MR1I
BitField.description: Interrupt on MR1: an interrupt is generated when MR1 matches the value in the TC.

BitField.name: MR1R
BitField.description: Reset on MR1: the TC will be reset if MR1 matches it.

BitField.name: MR1S
BitField.description: Stop on MR1: the TC and PC will be stopped and TCR[0] will be set to 0 if MR1 matches the TC.

BitField.name: MR2I
BitField.description: Interrupt on MR2: an interrupt is generated when MR2 matches the value in the TC.

BitField.name: MR2R
BitField.description: Reset on MR2: the TC will be reset if MR2 matches it.

BitField.name: MR2S
BitField.description: Stop on MR2: the TC and PC will be stopped and TCR[0] will be set to 0 if MR2 matches the TC.

BitField.name: MR3I
BitField.description: Interrupt on MR3: an interrupt is generated when MR3 matches the value in the TC.

BitField.name: MR3R
BitField.description: Reset on MR3: the TC will be reset if MR3 matches it.

BitField.name: MR3S
BitField.description: Stop on MR3: the TC and PC will be stopped and TCR[0] will be set to 0 if MR3 matches the TC.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: MR0
Register.description: Match Register. MR can be enabled through the MCR to reset the TC, stop both the TC and PC, and/or generate an interrupt every time MR matches the TC.

BitField.name: MATCH
BitField.description: Timer counter match value.

Register.name: MR1
Register.description: Match Register. MR can be enabled through the MCR to reset the TC, stop both the TC and PC, and/or generate an interrupt every time MR matches the TC.

BitField.name: MATCH
BitField.description: Timer counter match value.

Register.name: MR2
Register.description: Match Register. MR can be enabled through the MCR to reset the TC, stop both the TC and PC, and/or generate an interrupt every time MR matches the TC.

BitField.name: MATCH
BitField.description: Timer counter match value.

Register.name: MR3
Register.description: Match Register. MR can be enabled through the MCR to reset the TC, stop both the TC and PC, and/or generate an interrupt every time MR matches the TC.

BitField.name: MATCH
BitField.description: Timer counter match value.

Register.name: CCR
Register.description: Capture Control Register (CCR). The CCR controls which edges of the capture inputs are used to load the Capture Registers and whether or not an interrupt is generated when a capture takes place.

BitField.name: CAP0RE
BitField.description: Capture on CT32Bn_CAP0 rising edge: a sequence of 0 then 1 on CT32Bn_CAP0 will cause CR0 to be loaded with the contents of TC.

BitField.name: CAP0FE
BitField.description: Capture on CT32Bn_CAP0 falling edge: a sequence of 1 then 0 on CT32Bn_CAP0 will cause CR0 to be loaded with the contents of TC.

BitField.name: CAP0I
BitField.description: Interrupt on CT32Bn_CAP0 event: a CR0 load due to a CT32Bn_CAP0 event will generate an interrupt.

BitField.name: CAP1RE
BitField.description: Capture on CT32Bn_CAP1 rising edge: a sequence of 0 then 1 on CT32Bn_CAP1 will cause CR1 to be loaded with the contents of TC.

BitField.name: CAP1FE
BitField.description: Capture on CT32Bn_CAP1 falling edge: a sequence of 1 then 0 on CT32Bn_CAP1 will cause CR1 to be loaded with the contents of TC.

BitField.name: CAP1I
BitField.description: Interrupt on CT32Bn_CAP1 event: a CR1 load due to a CT32Bn_CAP1 event will generate an interrupt.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: CR0
Register.description: Capture Register (CR). CR is loaded with the value of TC when there is an event on the CT16Bn_CAPm input.

BitField.name: CAP
BitField.description: Timer counter capture value.

Register.name: CR1
Register.description: Capture Register (CR). CR is loaded with the value of TC when there is an event on the CT16Bn_CAPm input.

BitField.name: CAP
BitField.description: Timer counter capture value.

Register.name: EMR
Register.description: External Match Register (EMR). The EMR controls the match function and the external match pins CT32B0_MAT[3:0].

BitField.name: EM0
BitField.description: External Match 0. This bit reflects the state of output CT32Bn_MAT0, whether or not this output is connected to its pin. When a match occurs between the TC and MR0, this bit can either toggle, go LOW, go HIGH, or do nothing. Bits EMR[5:4] control the functionality of this output. This bit is driven to the CT32B0_MAT0/CT16B1_MAT0 pins if the match function is selected in the IOCON registers (0 = LOW, 1 = HIGH).

BitField.name: EM1
BitField.description: External Match 1. This bit reflects the state of output CT32Bn_MAT1, whether or not this output is connected to its pin. When a match occurs between the TC and MR1, this bit can either toggle, go LOW, go HIGH, or do nothing. Bits EMR[7:6] control the functionality of this output. This bit is driven to the CT32B0_MAT1/CT16B1_MAT1 pins if the match function is selected in the IOCON registers (0 = LOW, 1 = HIGH).

BitField.name: EM2
BitField.description: External Match 2. This bit reflects the state of output CT32Bn_MAT2, whether or not this output is connected to its pin. When a match occurs between the TC and MR2, this bit can either toggle, go LOW, go HIGH, or do nothing. Bits EMR[9:8] control the functionality of this output. This bit is driven to the CT32B0_MAT2/CT16B1_MAT2 pins if the match function is selected in the IOCON registers (0 = LOW, 1 = HIGH).

BitField.name: EM3
BitField.description: External Match 3. This bit reflects the state of output CT32Bn_MAT3, whether or not this output is connected to its pin. When a match occurs between the TC and MR3, this bit can either toggle, go LOW, go HIGH, or do nothing. Bits EMR[11:10] control the functionality of this output. This bit is driven to the CT32B0_MAT3/CT16B1_MAT3 pins if the match function is selected in the IOCON registers (0 = LOW, 1 = HIGH).

BitField.name: EMC0
BitField.description: External Match Control 0. Determines the functionality of External Match 0.

BitField.name: EM3
BitField.description: External Match 3. This bit reflects the state of output CT32Bn_MAT3, whether or not this output is connected to its pin. When a match occurs between the TC and MR3, this bit can either toggle, go LOW, go HIGH, or do nothing. Bits EMR[11:10] control the functionality of this output. This bit is driven to the CT32B0_MAT3/CT16B1_MAT3 pins if the match function is selected in the IOCON registers (0 = LOW, 1 = HIGH).

BitField.name: EMC0
BitField.description: External Match Control 0. Determines the functionality of External Match 0.

Enum.name: CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND
Enum.description: Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (CT32Bn_MATm pin is LOW if pinned out).

Enum.name: SET_THE_CORRESPONDIN
Enum.description: Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (CT32Bn_MATm pin is HIGH if pinned out).

Enum.name: TOGGLE_THE_CORRESPON
Enum.description: Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

BitField.name: EMC1
BitField.description: External Match Control 1. Determines the functionality of External Match 1.

Enum.name: CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND
Enum.description: Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (CT32Bn_MATm pin is LOW if pinned out).

Enum.name: SET_THE_CORRESPONDIN
Enum.description: Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (CT32Bn_MATm pin is HIGH if pinned out).

Enum.name: TOGGLE_THE_CORRESPON
Enum.description: Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

BitField.name: EMC2
BitField.description: External Match Control 2. Determines the functionality of External Match 2.

Enum.name: CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND
Enum.description: Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (CT32Bn_MATm pin is LOW if pinned out).

Enum.name: SET_THE_CORRESPONDIN
Enum.description: Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (CT32Bn_MATm pin is HIGH if pinned out).

Enum.name: TOGGLE_THE_CORRESPON
Enum.description: Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

BitField.name: EMC3
BitField.description: External Match Control 3. Determines the functionality of External Match 3.

Enum.name: CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND
Enum.description: Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (CT32Bn_MATm pin is LOW if pinned out).

Enum.name: SET_THE_CORRESPONDIN
Enum.description: Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (CT32Bn_MATm pin is HIGH if pinned out).

Enum.name: TOGGLE_THE_CORRESPON
Enum.description: Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: CTCR
Register.description: Count Control Register (CTCR). The CTCR selects between Timer and Counter mode, and in Counter mode selects the signal and edge(s) for counting.

BitField.name: CTM
BitField.description: Counter/Timer Mode. This field selects which rising PCLK edges can increment Timer's Prescale Counter (PC), or clear PC and increment Timer Counter (TC). Timer Mode: every rising PCLK edge

Enum.name: TIMER_MODE_EVERY_RI
Enum.description: Timer Mode: every rising PCLK edge

Enum.name: COUNTER_MODE_TC_IS_
Enum.description: Counter Mode: TC is incremented on rising edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

Enum.name: COUNTER_MODE_TC_IS_
Enum.description: Counter Mode: TC is incremented on falling edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

Enum.name: COUNTER_MODE_TC_IS_
Enum.description: Counter Mode: TC is incremented on both edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

BitField.name: CIS
BitField.description: Count Input Select. When bits 1:0 in this register are not 00, these bits select which CAP pin is sampled for clocking:

Enum.name: RESERVED_NOTE_IF_CO
Enum.description: Reserved Note: If Counter mode is selected in the TnCTCR, the 3 bits for that input in the Capture Control Register (TnCCR) must be programmed as 000.

BitField.name: ENCC
BitField.description: Setting this bit to one enables clearing of the timer and the prescaler when the capture-edge event specified in bits 7:5 occurs.

BitField.name: SELCC
BitField.description: When bit 4 is one, these bits select which capture input edge will cause the timer and prescaler to be cleared. These bits have no effect when bit 4 is zero.

Enum.name: RISING_EDGE_OF_CAP0_
Enum.description: Rising Edge of CAP0 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set).

Enum.name: FALLING_EDGE_OF_CAP0
Enum.description: Falling Edge of CAP0 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set).

Enum.name: RISING_EDGE_OF_CAP1_
Enum.description: Rising Edge of CAP1 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set).

Enum.name: FALLING_EDGE_OF_CAP1
Enum.description: Falling Edge of CAP1 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: PWMC
Register.description: PWM Control Register (PWMCON). The PWMCON enables PWM mode for the external match pins CT32B0_MAT[3:0].

BitField.name: PWMEN0
BitField.description: PWM channel 0 enable

Enum.name: PWM_MODE_IS_ENABLED_
Enum.description: PWM mode is enabled for CT32Bn_MAT0.

BitField.name: PWMEN1
BitField.description: PWM channel 1 enable

Enum.name: PWM_MODE_IS_ENABLED_
Enum.description: PWM mode is enabled for CT32Bn_MAT1.

BitField.name: PWMEN2
BitField.description: PWM channel 2 enable

Enum.name: PWM_MODE_IS_ENABLED_
Enum.description: PWM mode is enabled for CT32Bn_MAT2.

BitField.name: PWMEN3
BitField.description: PWM channel 3 enable Note: It is recommended to use match channel 3 to set the PWM cycle.

Enum.name: PWM_MODE_IS_ENABLED_
Enum.description: PWM mode is enabled for CT32Bn_MAT3.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: CR
Register.description: A/D Control Register. The ADCR register must be written to select the operating mode before A/D conversion can occur.

BitField.name: SEL
BitField.description: Selects which of the AD7:0 pins is (are) to be sampled and converted. Bit 0 selects Pin AD0, bit 1 selects pin AD1,..., and bit 7 selects pin AD7. In software-controlled mode (BURST = 0), only one channel can be selected, i.e. only one of these bits should be 1. In hardware scan mode (BURST = 1), any numbers of channels can be selected, i.e any or all bits can be set to 1. If all bits are set to 0, channel 0 is selected automatically (SEL = 0x01).

BitField.name: CLKDIV
BitField.description: The APB clock (PCLK) is divided by CLKDIV +1 to produce the clock for the ADC, which should be less than or equal to 4.5 MHz. Typically, software should program the smallest value in this field that yields a clock of 4.5 MHz or slightly less, but in certain cases (such as a high-impedance analog source) a slower clock may be desirable.

BitField.name: BURST
BitField.description: Burst mode

Enum.name: SWMODE
Enum.description: Software-controlled mode: Conversions are software-controlled and require 11 clocks.

Enum.name: HWMODE
Enum.description: Hardware scan mode: The AD converter does repeated conversions at the rate selected by the CLKS field, scanning (if necessary) through the pins selected by 1s in the SEL field. The first conversion after the start corresponds to the least-significant bit set to 1 in the SEL field, then the next higher bits (pins) set to 1 are scanned if applicable. Repeated conversions can be terminated by clearing this bit, but the conversion in progress when this bit is cleared will be completed. Important: START bits must be 000 when BURST = 1 or conversions will not start.

BitField.name: CLKS
BitField.description: This field selects the number of clocks used for each conversion in Burst mode, and the number of bits of accuracy of the result in the LS bits of ADDR, between 11 clocks (10 bits) and 4 clocks (3 bits).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: START
BitField.description: When the BURST bit is 0, these bits control whether and when an A/D conversion is started:

Enum.name: STOP
Enum.description: No start (this value should be used when clearing PDN to 0).

Enum.name: EDGEPIO0_2
Enum.description: Start conversion when the edge selected by bit 27 occurs on PIO0_2/SSEL/CT16B0_CAP0.

Enum.name: EDGEPIO1_5
Enum.description: Start conversion when the edge selected by bit 27 occurs on PIO1_5/DIR/CT32B0_CAP0.

Enum.name: EDGECT32B0_MAT0_1
Enum.description: Start conversion when the edge selected by bit 27 occurs on CT32B0_MAT0[1].

Enum.name: EDGECT32B0_MAT1_1
Enum.description: Start conversion when the edge selected by bit 27 occurs on CT32B0_MAT1[1].

Enum.name: EDGECT16B0_MAT0_1
Enum.description: Start conversion when the edge selected by bit 27 occurs on CT16B0_MAT0[1].

Enum.name: EDGECT16B0_MAT1_1
Enum.description: Start conversion when the edge selected by bit 27 occurs on CT16B0_MAT1[1].

BitField.name: EDGE
BitField.description: This bit is significant only when the START field contains 010-111. In these cases: Start conversion on a falling edge on the selected CAP/MAT signal.

Enum.name: RISING
Enum.description: Start conversion on a rising edge on the selected CAP/MAT signal.

Enum.name: FALLING
Enum.description: Start conversion on a rising edge on the selected CAP/MAT signal.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: GDR
Register.description: A/D Global Data Register. Contains the result of the most recent A/D conversion.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. These bits always read as zeroes.

BitField.name: V_VREF
BitField.description: When DONE is 1, this field contains a binary fraction representing the voltage on the ADn pin selected by the SEL field, divided by the voltage on the VDD pin. Zero in the field indicates that the voltage on the ADn pin was less than, equal to, or close to that on VSS, while 0x3FF indicates that the voltage on ADn was close to, equal to, or greater than that on VREF.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. These bits always read as zeroes.

BitField.name: CHN
BitField.description: These bits contain the channel from which the result bits V_VREF were converted.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. These bits always read as zeroes.

BitField.name: OVERRUN
BitField.description: This bit is 1 in burst mode if the results of one or more conversions was (were) lost and overwritten before the conversion that produced the result in the V_VREF bits.

BitField.name: DONE
BitField.description: This bit is set to 1 when an A/D conversion completes. It is cleared when this register is read and when the ADCR is written. If the ADCR is written while a conversion is still in progress, this bit is set and a new conversion is started.

Register.name: STAT
Register.description: A/D Status Register. This register contains DONE and OVERRUN flags for all of the A/D channels, as well as the A/D interrupt flag.

BitField.name: DONE
BitField.description: These bits mirror the DONE status flags that appear in the result register for each A/D channel n.

BitField.name: OVERRUN
BitField.description: These bits mirror the OVERRRUN status flags that appear in the result register for each A/D channel n. Reading ADSTAT allows checking the status of all A/D channels simultaneously.

BitField.name: ADINT
BitField.description: This bit is the A/D interrupt flag. It is one when any of the individual A/D channel Done flags is asserted and enabled to contribute to the A/D interrupt via the ADINTEN register.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Unused, always 0.

Register.name: INTEN
Register.description: A/D Interrupt Enable Register. This register contains enable bits that allow the DONE flag of each A/D channel to be included or excluded from contributing to the generation of an A/D interrupt.

BitField.name: ADINTENn
BitField.description: These bits allow control over which A/D channels generate interrupts for conversion completion. When bit 0 is one, completion of a conversion on A/D channel 0 will generate an interrupt, when bit 1 is one, completion of a conversion on A/D channel 1 will generate an interrupt, etc.

BitField.name: ADGINTEN
BitField.description: When 1, enables the global DONE flag in ADDR to generate an interrupt. When 0, only the individual A/D channels enabled by ADINTEN 7:0 will generate interrupts.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Unused, always 0.

Register.name: DR0
Register.description: A/D Channel n Data Register. This register contains the result of the most recent conversion completed on channel n.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, always 0. These bits always read as zeroes.

BitField.name: V_VREF
BitField.description: When DONE is 1, this field contains a binary fraction representing the voltage on the ADn pin, divided by the voltage on the VREF pin. Zero in the field indicates that the voltage on the ADn pin was less than, equal to, or close to that on VREF, while 0x3FF indicates that the voltage on AD input was close to, equal to, or greater than that on VREF.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: These bits always read as zeroes.

BitField.name: OVERRUN
BitField.description: This bit is 1 in burst mode if the results of one or more conversions was (were) lost and overwritten before the conversion that produced the result in the V_VREF bits.This bit is cleared by reading this register.

BitField.name: DONE
BitField.description: This bit is set to 1 when an A/D conversion completes. It is cleared when this register is read.

Register.description: A/D Channel n Data Register. This register contains the result of the most recent conversion completed on channel n.

Register.name: PCON
Register.description: Power control register

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Do not write 1 to this bit.

BitField.name: DPDEN
BitField.description: Deep power-down mode enable

Enum.name: SLEEPMODE
Enum.description: ARM WFI will enter Sleep or Deep-sleep mode (clock to ARM Cortex-M0 core turned off).

Enum.name: DEEPPOWERDOWN
Enum.description: ARM WFI will enter Deep-power down mode (ARM Cortex-M0 core powered-down).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Do not write ones to this bit.

BitField.name: SLEEPFLAG
BitField.description: Sleep mode flag

Enum.name: NOPOWERDOWN
Enum.description: Read: No power-down mode entered. LPC111x/LPC11C1x is in Active mode. Write: No effect.

Enum.name: POWERDOWN
Enum.description: Read: Sleep/Deep-sleep or Deep power-down mode entered. Write: Writing a 1 clears the SLEEPFLAG bit to 0.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Do not write ones to this bit.

BitField.name: DPDFLAG
BitField.description: Deep power-down flag

Enum.name: NODEEPPOWERDOWN
Enum.description: Read: Deep power-down mode not entered. Write: No effect.

Enum.name: DEEPPOWERDOWN
Enum.description: Read: Deep power-down mode entered. Write: Clear the Deep power-down flag.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Do not write ones to this bit.

Register.name: GPREG0
Register.description: General purpose register

BitField.name: GPDATA
BitField.description: Data retained during Deep power-down mode.

Register.description: General purpose register

BitField.description: Data retained during Deep power-down mode.

BitField.description: WAKEUP pin hysteresis enable

RegisterGroup.name: FLASHCTRL
RegisterGroup.description: Product name title=UM10462 Chapter title=LPC11U1x Flash programming firmware Modification date=3/17/2011 Major revision=0 Minor revision=3

Register.name: FLASHCFG
Register.description: Flash memory access time configuration register

BitField.name: FLASHTIM
BitField.description: Flash memory access time. FLASHTIM +1 is equal to the number of system clocks used for flash access.

Enum.name: 1_SYSTEM_CLOCK_FLASH
Enum.description: 1 system clock flash access time (for system clock frequencies of up to 20 MHz).

Enum.name: 2_SYSTEM_CLOCKS_FLAS
Enum.description: 2 system clocks flash access time (for system clock frequencies of up to 40 MHz).

Enum.name: 3_SYSTEM_CLOCKS_FLAS
Enum.description: 3 system clocks flash access time (for system clock frequencies of up to 50 MHz).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software must not change the value of these bits. Bits 31:2 must be written back exactly as read.

Register.name: FMSSTART
Register.description: Signature start address register

BitField.name: START
BitField.description: Signature generation start address (corresponds to AHB byte address bits[20:4]).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: FMSSTOP
Register.description: Signature stop-address register

BitField.name: STOP
BitField.description: BIST stop address divided by 16 (corresponds to AHB byte address [20:4]).

BitField.name: SIG_START
BitField.description: Start control bit for signature generation.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: SW0_31_0
BitField.description: Word 0 of 128-bit signature (bits 31 to 0).

BitField.name: SW1_63_32
BitField.description: Word 1 of 128-bit signature (bits 63 to 32).

BitField.name: SW2_95_64
BitField.description: Word 2 of 128-bit signature (bits 95 to 64).

BitField.name: SW3_127_96
BitField.description: Word 3 of 128-bit signature (bits 127 to 96).

Register.name: FMSTAT
Register.description: Signature generation status register

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: SIG_DONE
BitField.description: When 1, a previously started signature generation has completed. See FMSTATCLR register description for clearing this flag.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: FMSTATCLR
Register.description: Signature generation status clear register

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: SIG_DONE_CLR
BitField.description: Writing a 1 to this bits clears the signature generation completion flag (SIG_DONE) in the FMSTAT register.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: CR0
Register.description: Control Register 0. Selects the serial clock rate, bus type, and data size.

BitField.name: DSS
BitField.description: Data Size Select. This field controls the number of bits transferred in each frame. Values 0000-0010 are not supported and should not be used.

BitField.name: FRF
BitField.description: Frame Format.

Enum.name: RESERVED
Enum.description: This combination is not supported and should not be used.

BitField.name: CPOL
BitField.description: Clock Out Polarity. This bit is only used in SPI mode.

Enum.name: LOW
Enum.description: SPI controller maintains the bus clock low between frames.

Enum.name: HIGH
Enum.description: SPI controller maintains the bus clock high between frames.

BitField.name: CPHA
BitField.description: Clock Out Phase. This bit is only used in SPI mode.

Enum.name: FIRSTCLOCK
Enum.description: SPI controller captures serial data on the first clock transition of the frame, that is, the transition away from the inter-frame state of the clock line.

Enum.name: SECONDCLOCK
Enum.description: SPI controller captures serial data on the second clock transition of the frame, that is, the transition back to the inter-frame state of the clock line.

BitField.name: SCR
BitField.description: Serial Clock Rate. The number of prescaler output clocks per bit on the bus, minus one. Given that CPSDVSR is the prescale divider, and the APB clock PCLK clocks the prescaler, the bit frequency is PCLK / (CPSDVSR X [SCR+1]).

Register.name: CR1
Register.description: Control Register 1. Selects master/slave and other modes.

BitField.name: LBM
BitField.description: Loop Back Mode.

Enum.name: LOOPBACK
Enum.description: Serial input is taken from the serial output (MOSI or MISO) rather than the serial input pin (MISO or MOSI respectively).

BitField.name: SSE
BitField.description: SPI Enable.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: The SPI controller will interact with other devices on the serial bus. Software should write the appropriate control information to the other SPI/SSP registers and interrupt controller registers, before setting this bit.

BitField.name: MS
BitField.description: Master/Slave Mode.This bit can only be written when the SSE bit is 0.

Enum.name: MASTER
Enum.description: The SPI controller acts as a master on the bus, driving the SCLK, MOSI, and SSEL lines and receiving the MISO line.

Enum.name: SLAVE
Enum.description: The SPI controller acts as a slave on the bus, driving MISO line and receiving SCLK, MOSI, and SSEL lines.

BitField.name: SOD
BitField.description: Slave Output Disable. This bit is relevant only in slave mode (MS = 1). If it is 1, this blocks this SPI controller from driving the transmit data line (MISO).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: DR
Register.description: Data Register. Writes fill the transmit FIFO, and reads empty the receive FIFO.

BitField.name: DATA
BitField.description: Write: software can write data to be sent in a future frame to this register whenever the TNF bit in the Status register is 1, indicating that the Tx FIFO is not full. If the Tx FIFO was previously empty and the SPI controller is not busy on the bus, transmission of the data will begin immediately. Otherwise the data written to this register will be sent as soon as all previous data has been sent (and received). If the data length is less than 16 bit, software must right-justify the data written to this register. Read: software can read data from this register whenever the RNE bit in the Status register is 1, indicating that the Rx FIFO is not empty. When software reads this register, the SPI controller returns data from the least recent frame in the Rx FIFO. If the data length is less than 16 bit, the data is right-justified in this field with higher order bits filled with 0s.

Register.name: SR
Register.description: Status Register

BitField.name: TFE
BitField.description: Transmit FIFO Empty. This bit is 1 is the Transmit FIFO is empty, 0 if not.

BitField.name: TNF
BitField.description: Transmit FIFO Not Full. This bit is 0 if the Tx FIFO is full, 1 if not.

BitField.name: RNE
BitField.description: Receive FIFO Not Empty. This bit is 0 if the Receive FIFO is empty, 1 if not.

BitField.name: RFF
BitField.description: Receive FIFO Full. This bit is 1 if the Receive FIFO is full, 0 if not.

BitField.name: BSY
BitField.description: Busy. This bit is 0 if the SPI controller is idle, 1 if it is currently sending/receiving a frame and/or the Tx FIFO is not empty.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: CPSR
Register.description: Clock Prescale Register

BitField.name: CPSDVSR
BitField.description: This even value between 2 and 254, by which SPI_PCLK is divided to yield the prescaler output clock. Bit 0 always reads as 0.

Register.name: IMSC
Register.description: Interrupt Mask Set and Clear Register

BitField.name: RORIM
BitField.description: Software should set this bit to enable interrupt when a Receive Overrun occurs, that is, when the Rx FIFO is full and another frame is completely received. The ARM spec implies that the preceding frame data is overwritten by the new frame data when this occurs.

BitField.name: RTIM
BitField.description: Software should set this bit to enable interrupt when a Receive Time-out condition occurs. A Receive Time-out occurs when the Rx FIFO is not empty, and no has not been read for a time-out period. The time-out period is the same for master and slave modes and is determined by the SSP bit rate: 32 bits at PCLK / (CPSDVSR x [SCR+1]).

BitField.name: RXIM
BitField.description: Software should set this bit to enable interrupt when the Rx FIFO is at least half full.

BitField.name: TXIM
BitField.description: Software should set this bit to enable interrupt when the Tx FIFO is at least half empty.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: RIS
Register.description: Raw Interrupt Status Register

BitField.name: RORRIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if another frame was completely received while the RxFIFO was full. The ARM spec implies that the preceding frame data is overwritten by the new frame data when this occurs.

BitField.name: RTRIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if the Rx FIFO is not empty, and has not been read for a time-out period. The time-out period is the same for master and slave modes and is determined by the SSP bit rate: 32 bits at PCLK / (CPSDVSR x [SCR+1]).

BitField.name: RXRIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if the Rx FIFO is at least half full.

BitField.name: TXRIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if the Tx FIFO is at least half empty.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: MIS
Register.description: Masked Interrupt Status Register

BitField.name: RORMIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if another frame was completely received while the RxFIFO was full, and this interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: RTMIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if the Rx FIFO is not empty, has not been read for a time-out period, and this interrupt is enabled. The time-out period is the same for master and slave modes and is determined by the SSP bit rate: 32 bits at PCLK / (CPSDVSR x [SCR+1]).

BitField.name: RXMIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if the Rx FIFO is at least half full, and this interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: TXMIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if the Tx FIFO is at least half empty, and this interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: ICR
Register.description: SSPICR Interrupt Clear Register

BitField.name: RORIC
BitField.description: Writing a 1 to this bit clears the frame was received when RxFIFO was full interrupt.

BitField.name: RTIC
BitField.description: Writing a 1 to this bit clears the Rx FIFO was not empty and has not been read for a timeout period interrupt. The timeout period is the same for master and slave modes and is determined by the SSP bit rate: 32 bits at PCLK / (CPSDVSR x [SCR+1]).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.
