Register.name: DEVICE_ID
Register.description: Device ID register 0 for parts LPC1100, LPC1100C, LPC1100L.

RegisterGroup.name: C_CAN
RegisterGroup.description: Product name title=UM10398 Chapter title=LPC111x/LPC11Cxx C_CAN controller Modification date=9/19/2011 Major revision=7 Minor revision=not available

Register.name: CANCNTL
Register.description: CAN control

Enum.name: INITIALIZATION
Enum.description: Initialization is started. On reset, software needs to initialize the CAN controller.

BitField.name: IE
BitField.description: Module interrupt enable

Enum.name: DISABLE_CAN_INTERRUP
Enum.description: Disable CAN interrupts. The interrupt line is always HIGH.

Enum.name: ENABLE_CAN_INTERRUPT
Enum.description: Enable CAN interrupts. The interrupt line is set to LOW and remains LOW until all pending interrupts are cleared.

BitField.name: SIE
BitField.description: Status change interrupt enable

Enum.name: DISABLE_STATUS_CHANG
Enum.description: Disable status change interrupts. No status change interrupt will be generated.

Enum.name: ENABLE_STATUS_CHANGE
Enum.description: Enable status change interrupts. A status change interrupt will be generated when a message transfer is successfully completed or a CAN bus error is detected.

BitField.name: EIE
BitField.description: Error interrupt enable

Enum.name: DISABLE_ERROR_INTERR
Enum.description: Disable error interrupt. No error status interrupt will be generated.

Enum.name: ENABLE_ERROR_INTERRU
Enum.description: Enable error interrupt. A change in the bits BOFF or EWARN in the CANSTAT registers will generate an interrupt.

BitField.name: DAR
BitField.description: Disable automatic retransmission

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Automatic retransmission of disturbed messages enabled.

BitField.name: CCE
BitField.description: Configuration change enable

Enum.name: NOACCESS
Enum.description: The CPU has no write access to the bit timing register.

Enum.name: ACCESS
Enum.description: The CPU has write access to the CANBT register while the INIT bit is one.

BitField.name: TEST
BitField.description: Test mode enable

Register.name: CANSTAT
Register.description: Status register

BitField.name: LEC
BitField.description: Last error code Type of the last error to occur on the CAN bus.The LEC field holds a code which indicates the type of the last error to occur on the CAN bus. This field will be cleared to 0 when a message has been transferred (reception or transmission) without error. The unused code 111 may be written by the CPU to check for updates.

Enum.name: STUFF_ERROR
Enum.description: Stuff error: More than 5 equal bits in a sequence have occurred in a part of a received message where this is not allowed.

Enum.name: FORM_ERROR
Enum.description: Form error: A fixed format part of a received frame has the wrong format.

Enum.name: ACKERROR
Enum.description: AckError: The message this CAN core transmitted was not acknowledged.

Enum.name: BIT1ERROR
Enum.description: Bit1Error: During the transmission of a message (with the exception of the arbitration field), the device wanted to send a HIGH/recessive level (bit of logical value 1), but the monitored bus value was LOW/dominant.

Enum.name: BIT0ERROR
Enum.description: Bit0Error: During the transmission of a message (or acknowledge bit, or active error flag, or overload flag), the device wanted to send a LOW/dominant level (data or identifier bit logical value 0), but the monitored Bus value was HIGH/recessive. During busoff recovery this status is set each time a sequence of 11 HIGH/recessive bits has been monitored. This enables the CPU to monitor the proceeding of the busoff recovery sequence (indicating the bus is not stuck at LOW/dominant or continuously disturbed).

Enum.name: CRCERROR
Enum.description: CRCError: The CRC checksum was incorrect in the message received.

Enum.name: UNUSED
Enum.description: Unused: No CAN bus event was detected (written by the CPU).

BitField.name: TXOK
BitField.description: Transmitted a message successfully This bit is reset by the CPU. It is never reset by the CAN controller.

Enum.name: NOTRANSMIT
Enum.description: Since this bit was reset by the CPU, no message has been successfully transmitted.

Enum.name: TRANSMIT
Enum.description: Since this bit was last reset by the CPU, a message has been successfully transmitted (error free and acknowledged by at least one other node).

BitField.name: RXOK
BitField.description: Received a message successfully This bit is reset by the CPU. It is never reset by the CAN controller.

Enum.name: NOTRANSMIT
Enum.description: Since this bit was last reset by the CPU, no message has been successfully transmitted.

Enum.name: TRANSMIT
Enum.description: Since this bit was last set to zero by the CPU, a message has been successfully received independent of the result of acceptance filtering.

BitField.name: EPASS
BitField.description: Error passive

Enum.name: ACTIVE
Enum.description: The CAN controller is in the error active state.

Enum.name: PASSIVE
Enum.description: The CAN controller is in the error passive state as defined in the CAN 2.0 specification.

BitField.name: EWARN
BitField.description: Warning status

Enum.name: BELOWWARNINGLIM
Enum.description: Both error counters are below the error warning limit of 96.

Enum.name: WARNINGLIM
Enum.description: At least one of the error counters in the EML has reached the error warning limit of 96.

BitField.name: BOFF
BitField.description: Busoff status

Enum.name: NOTBUSOFF
Enum.description: The CAN module is not in busoff.

Enum.name: BUSOFF
Enum.description: The CAN controller is in busoff state.

Register.name: CANEC
Register.description: Error counter

BitField.name: TEC_7_0
BitField.description: Transmit error counter Current value of the transmit error counter (maximum value 255)

BitField.name: REC_6_0
BitField.description: Receive error counter Current value of the receive error counter (maximum value 127).

BitField.name: RP
BitField.description: Receive error passive

Enum.name: BELOWERRORPASSIVE
Enum.description: The receive counter is below the error passive level.

Enum.name: ERRORPASSIVE
Enum.description: The receive counter has reached the error passive level as defined in the CAN2.0 specification.

Register.name: CANBT
Register.description: Bit timing register

BitField.name: BRP
BitField.description: Baud rate prescaler The value by which the oscillator frequency is divided for generating the bit time quanta. The bit time is built up from a multiple of this quanta. Valid values for the Baud Rate Prescaler are 0 to 63.[1]

BitField.name: SJW
BitField.description: (Re)synchronization jump width Valid programmed values are 0 to 3.[1]

BitField.name: TSEG1
BitField.description: Time segment before the sample point Valid values are 1 to 15.[1]

BitField.name: TSEG2
BitField.description: Time segment after the sample point Valid values are 0 to 7.[1]

Register.name: CANINT
Register.description: Interrupt register

BitField.name: INTID
BitField.description: 0x0000 = No interrupt is pending. 0x0001 - 0x0020 = Number of message object which caused the interrupt. 0x0021 - 0x7FFF = Unused 0x8000 = Status interrupt 0x8001 - 0xFFFF = Unused

Register.name: CANTEST
Register.description: Test register

BitField.name: BASIC
BitField.description: Basic mode

Enum.name: TXRX
Enum.description: IF1 registers used as TX buffer, IF2 registers used as RX buffer.

BitField.name: SILENT
BitField.description: Silent mode

Enum.name: SILENT
Enum.description: The module is in silent mode.

BitField.name: LBACK
BitField.description: Loop back mode

BitField.name: TX
BitField.description: Control of CAN_TXD pins

Enum.name: LEVEL
Enum.description: Level at the CAN_TXD pin is controlled by the CAN controller. This is the value at reset.

Enum.name: TXD
Enum.description: The sample point can be monitored at the CAN_TXD pin.

BitField.name: RX
BitField.description: Monitors the actual value of the CAN_RXD pin.

Register.name: CANBRPE
Register.description: Baud rate prescaler extension register

BitField.name: BRPE
BitField.description: Baud rate prescaler extension By programming BRPE the Baud Rate Prescaler can be extended to values up to 1023. Hardware interprets the value as the value of BRPE (MSBs) and BRP (LSBs) plus one. Allowed values are 0 to 15.

Register.name: CANIF1_CMDREQ
Register.description: Message interface command request

BitField.name: MN
BitField.description: Message number 0x01 - 0x20 = Valid message numbers. The message object in the message RAM is selected for data transfer. 0x00 = Not a valid message number. This value is interpreted as 0x20.[1] 0x21 - 0x3F = Not a valid message number. This value is interpreted as 0x01 - 0x1F.[1]

BitField.name: BUSY
BitField.description: BUSY flag

Enum.name: ZERO
Enum.description: Set to zero by hardware when read/write action to this Command request register has finished.

Enum.name: ONE
Enum.description: Set to one by hardware when writing to this Command request register.

Register.name: CANIF2_CMDREQ
Register.description: Message interface command request

BitField.name: MN
BitField.description: Message number 0x01 - 0x20 = Valid message numbers. The message object in the message RAM is selected for data transfer. 0x00 = Not a valid message number. This value is interpreted as 0x20.[1] 0x21 - 0x3F = Not a valid message number. This value is interpreted as 0x01 - 0x1F.[1]

BitField.name: BUSY
BitField.description: BUSY flag

Enum.name: ZERO
Enum.description: Set to zero by hardware when read/write action to this Command request register has finished.

Enum.name: ONE
Enum.description: Set to one by hardware when writing to this Command request register.

Register.name: CANIF1_CMDMSK_W
Register.description: Message interface command mask - write direction

BitField.name: DATA_B
BitField.description: Access data bytes 4-7

Enum.name: TRANSFER_DATA_BYTES_
Enum.description: Transfer data bytes 4-7 to message object.

BitField.name: DATA_A
BitField.description: Access data bytes 0-3

Enum.name: TRANSFER_DATA_BYTES_
Enum.description: Transfer data bytes 0-3 to message object.

BitField.name: TXRQST
BitField.description: Access transmission request bit

Enum.name: NO_TRANSMISSION_REQU
Enum.description: No transmission request. TXRQSRT bit unchanged in IF1/2_MCTRL. If a transmission is requested by programming this bit, the TXRQST bit in the CANIFn_MCTRL register is ignored.

Enum.name: REQUEST_A_TRANSMISSI
Enum.description: Request a transmission. Set the TXRQST bit IF1/2_MCTRL.

BitField.name: CLRINTPND
BitField.description: This bit is ignored in the write direction.

BitField.name: CTRL
BitField.description: Access control bits

Enum.name: TRANSFER_CONTROL_BIT
Enum.description: Transfer control bits to message object

BitField.name: ARB

Enum.name: TRANSFER_IDENTIFIER

Enum.name: TRANSFER_IDENTIFIER_
Enum.description: Transfer Identifier MASK + MDIR + MXTD to message object.

BitField.name: WR_RD
BitField.description: Write transfer Transfer data from the selected message buffer registers to the message object addressed by the command request register CANIFn_CMDREQ.

Register.name: CANIF1_MSK1

Enum.description: The corresponding bit in the identifier of the message can not inhibit the match in the acceptance filtering.

Enum.name: ACCEPTANCEFILTERING

Register.name: CANIF1_ARB1
Register.description: Message interface 1 arbitration 1

BitField.name: ID_15_0
BitField.description: Message identifier 29-bit identifier (extended frame) 11-bit identifier (standard frame)

Register.name: CANIF2_ARB1
Register.description: Message interface 1 arbitration 1

BitField.name: ID_15_0
BitField.description: Message identifier 29-bit identifier (extended frame) 11-bit identifier (standard frame)

Register.name: CANIF1_ARB2
Register.description: Message interface 1 arbitration 2

BitField.name: ID_28_16
BitField.description: Message identifier 29-bit identifier (extended frame) 11-bit identifier (standard frame)

BitField.name: DIR
BitField.description: Message direction

Enum.name: RECEIVE
Enum.description: Direction = receive. On TXRQST, a Remote Frame with the identifier of this Message Object is transmitted. On reception of a Data Frame with matching identifier, that message is stored in this Message Object.

Enum.name: TRANSMIT
Enum.description: Direction = transmit. On TXRQST, the respective Message Object is transmitted as a Data Frame. On reception of a Remote Frame with matching identifier, the TXRQST bit of this Message Object is set (if RMTEN = one).

BitField.name: XTD
BitField.description: Extend identifier

Enum.name: 11_BIT_STANDARD_
Enum.description: The 11-bit standard identifier will be used for this message object.

Enum.name: 29_BIT_EXTENDED_
Enum.description: The 29-bit extended identifier will be used for this message object.

BitField.name: MSGVAL
BitField.description: Message valid The CPU must reset the MSGVAL bit of all unused Messages Objects during the initialization before it resets bit INIT in the CAN Control Register. This bit must also be reset before the identifier ID28:0, the control bits XTD, DIR, or the Data Length Code DLC3:0 are modified, or if the Messages Object is no longer required.

Enum.name: IGNORE
Enum.description: The message object is ignored by the message handler.

Enum.name: CONFIGURED
Enum.description: The message object is configured and should be considered by the message handler.

Register.name: CANIF2_ARB2
Register.description: Message interface 1 arbitration 2

BitField.name: ID_28_16
BitField.description: Message identifier 29-bit identifier (extended frame) 11-bit identifier (standard frame)

BitField.name: DIR
BitField.description: Message direction

Enum.name: RECEIVE
Enum.description: Direction = receive. On TXRQST, a Remote Frame with the identifier of this Message Object is transmitted. On reception of a Data Frame with matching identifier, that message is stored in this Message Object.

Enum.name: TRANSMIT
Enum.description: Direction = transmit. On TXRQST, the respective Message Object is transmitted as a Data Frame. On reception of a Remote Frame with matching identifier, the TXRQST bit of this Message Object is set (if RMTEN = one).

BitField.name: XTD
BitField.description: Extend identifier

Enum.name: 11_BIT_STANDARD_
Enum.description: The 11-bit standard identifier will be used for this message object.

Enum.name: 29_BIT_EXTENDED_
Enum.description: The 29-bit extended identifier will be used for this message object.

BitField.name: MSGVAL
BitField.description: Message valid The CPU must reset the MSGVAL bit of all unused Messages Objects during the initialization before it resets bit INIT in the CAN Control Register. This bit must also be reset before the identifier ID28:0, the control bits XTD, DIR, or the Data Length Code DLC3:0 are modified, or if the Messages Object is no longer required.

Enum.name: IGNORE
Enum.description: The message object is ignored by the message handler.

Enum.name: CONFIGURED
Enum.description: The message object is configured and should be considered by the message handler.

Register.name: CANIF1_MCTRL
Register.description: Message interface 1 message control

BitField.name: DLC_3_0
BitField.description: Data length code The Data Length Code of a Message Object must be defined the same as in all the corresponding objects with the same identifier at other nodes. When the Message Handler stores a data frame, it will write the DLC to the value given by the received message. 0000 - 1000 = Data frame has 0 - 8 data bytes. 1001 - 1111 = Data frame has 8 data bytes.

BitField.name: EOB
BitField.description: End of buffer

Enum.name: FIFO
Enum.description: Message object belongs to a FIFO buffer and is not the last message object of that FIFO buffer.

Enum.name: SINGELAST
Enum.description: Single message object or last message object of a FIFO buffer.

BitField.name: TXRQST
BitField.description: Transmit request

Enum.name: NOWAIT
Enum.description: This message object is not waiting for transmission.

Enum.name: WAIT
Enum.description: The transmission of this message object is requested and is not yet done

BitField.name: RMTEN
BitField.description: Remote enable

Enum.name: NOCHANGE
Enum.description: At the reception of a remote frame, TXRQST is left unchanged.

Enum.name: SET
Enum.description: At the reception of a remote frame, TXRQST is set.

BitField.name: RXIE
BitField.description: Receive interrupt enable

Enum.name: NOCHANGE
Enum.description: INTPND will be left unchanged after successful reception of a frame.

Enum.name: SET
Enum.description: INTPND will be set after successful reception of a frame.

BitField.name: TXIE
BitField.description: Transmit interrupt enable

Enum.name: NOCHANGE
Enum.description: The INTPND bit will be left unchanged after a successful transmission of a frame.

Enum.name: SET
Enum.description: INTPND will be set after a successful transmission of a frame.

BitField.name: UMASK
BitField.description: Use acceptance mask If UMASK is set to 1, the message object's mask bits have to be programmed during initialization of the message object before MAGVAL is set to 1.

Enum.name: USEMASK
Enum.description: Use mask (MSK[28:0], MXTD, and MDIR) for acceptance filtering.

BitField.name: INTPND
BitField.description: Interrupt pending

Enum.name: NOINTSOURCE
Enum.description: This message object is not the source of an interrupt.

Enum.name: INTSOURCE
Enum.description: This message object is the source of an interrupt. The Interrupt Identifier in the Interrupt Register will point to this message object if there is no other interrupt source with higher priority.

BitField.name: MSGLST
BitField.description: Message lost (only valid for message objects in the direction receive).

Enum.name: NOLOST
Enum.description: No message lost since this bit was reset last by the CPU.

Enum.name: NEWMESSAGE
Enum.description: The Message Handler stored a new message into this object when NEWDAT was still set, the CPU has lost a message.

BitField.name: NEWDAT
BitField.description: New data

Enum.name: NONEWDATA
Enum.description: No new data has been written into the data portion of this message object by the message handler since this flag was cleared last by the CPU.

Enum.name: NEWDATA
Enum.description: The message handler or the CPU has written new data into the data portion of this message object.

Register.name: CANIF2_MCTRL
Register.description: Message interface 1 message control

BitField.name: DLC_3_0
BitField.description: Data length code The Data Length Code of a Message Object must be defined the same as in all the corresponding objects with the same identifier at other nodes. When the Message Handler stores a data frame, it will write the DLC to the value given by the received message. 0000 - 1000 = Data frame has 0 - 8 data bytes. 1001 - 1111 = Data frame has 8 data bytes.

BitField.name: EOB
BitField.description: End of buffer

Enum.name: FIFO
Enum.description: Message object belongs to a FIFO buffer and is not the last message object of that FIFO buffer.

Enum.name: SINGELAST
Enum.description: Single message object or last message object of a FIFO buffer.

BitField.name: TXRQST
BitField.description: Transmit request

Enum.name: NOWAIT
Enum.description: This message object is not waiting for transmission.

Enum.name: WAIT
Enum.description: The transmission of this message object is requested and is not yet done

BitField.name: RMTEN
BitField.description: Remote enable

Enum.name: NOCHANGE
Enum.description: At the reception of a remote frame, TXRQST is left unchanged.

Enum.name: SET
Enum.description: At the reception of a remote frame, TXRQST is set.

BitField.name: RXIE
BitField.description: Receive interrupt enable

Enum.name: NOCHANGE
Enum.description: INTPND will be left unchanged after successful reception of a frame.

Enum.name: SET
Enum.description: INTPND will be set after successful reception of a frame.

BitField.name: TXIE
BitField.description: Transmit interrupt enable

Enum.name: NOCHANGE
Enum.description: The INTPND bit will be left unchanged after a successful transmission of a frame.

Enum.name: SET
Enum.description: INTPND will be set after a successful transmission of a frame.

BitField.name: UMASK
BitField.description: Use acceptance mask If UMASK is set to 1, the message object's mask bits have to be programmed during initialization of the message object before MAGVAL is set to 1.

Enum.name: USEMASK
Enum.description: Use mask (MSK[28:0], MXTD, and MDIR) for acceptance filtering.

BitField.name: INTPND
BitField.description: Interrupt pending

Enum.name: NOINTSOURCE
Enum.description: This message object is not the source of an interrupt.

Enum.name: INTSOURCE
Enum.description: This message object is the source of an interrupt. The Interrupt Identifier in the Interrupt Register will point to this message object if there is no other interrupt source with higher priority.

BitField.name: MSGLST
BitField.description: Message lost (only valid for message objects in the direction receive).

Enum.name: NOLOST
Enum.description: No message lost since this bit was reset last by the CPU.

Enum.name: NEWMESSAGE
Enum.description: The Message Handler stored a new message into this object when NEWDAT was still set, the CPU has lost a message.

Enum.name: NEWDATA

Register.description: Transmission request 1

BitField.name: TXRQST_16_1
BitField.description: Transmission request bit of message objects 16 to 1. 0 = This message object is not waiting for transmission. 1 = The transmission of this message object is requested and not yet done.

Register.name: CANTXREQ2
Register.description: Transmission request 2

BitField.name: TXRQST_32_17
BitField.description: Transmission request bit of message objects 32 to 17. 0 = This message object is not waiting for transmission. 1 = The transmission of this message object is requested and not yet done.

Register.name: CANND1
Register.description: New data 1

BitField.name: NEWDAT_16_1
BitField.description: New data bits of message objects 16 to 1. 0 = No new data has been written into the data portion of this Message Object by the Message Handler since last time this flag was cleared by the CPU. 1 = The Message Handler or the CPU has written new data into the data portion of this Message Object.

Register.description: New data 2

BitField.description: New data bits of message objects 32 to 17. 0 = No new data has been written into the data portion of this Message Object by the Message Handler since last time this flag was cleared by the CPU. 1 = The Message Handler or the CPU has written new data into the data portion of this Message Object.

Register.description: Interrupt pending 1

BitField.description: Interrupt pending bits of message objects 16 to 1. 0 = This message object is ignored by the message handler. 1 = This message object is the source of an interrupt.

Register.name: CANMSGV2

BitField.name: MSGVAL_32_17
BitField.description: Message valid bits of message objects 32 to 17. 0 = This message object is ignored by the message handler. 1 = This message object is configured and should be considered by the message handler.

Register.name: CANCLKDIV
Register.description: Can clock divider register

BitField.name: CLKDIVVAL
BitField.description: Clock divider value. CAN_CLK = PCLK/(CLKDIVVAL +1) 0000: CAN_CLK = PCLK divided by 1. 0001: CAN_CLK = PCLK divided by 2. 0010: CAN_CLK = PCLK divided by 3 0010: CAN_CLK = PCLK divided by 4. ... 1111: CAN_CLK = PCLK divided by 16.

Register.name: CR0
Register.description: Control Register 0. Selects the serial clock rate, bus type, and data size.

BitField.name: DSS
BitField.description: Data Size Select. This field controls the number of bits transferred in each frame. Values 0000-0010 are not supported and should not be used.

BitField.name: FRF
BitField.description: Frame Format.

Enum.name: RESERVED
Enum.description: This combination is not supported and should not be used.

BitField.name: CPOL
BitField.description: Clock Out Polarity. This bit is only used in SPI mode.

Enum.name: LOW
Enum.description: SPI controller maintains the bus clock low between frames.

Enum.name: HIGH
Enum.description: SPI controller maintains the bus clock high between frames.

BitField.name: CPHA
BitField.description: Clock Out Phase. This bit is only used in SPI mode.

Enum.name: FIRSTCLOCK
Enum.description: SPI controller captures serial data on the first clock transition of the frame, that is, the transition away from the inter-frame state of the clock line.

Enum.name: SECONDCLOCK
Enum.description: SPI controller captures serial data on the second clock transition of the frame, that is, the transition back to the inter-frame state of the clock line.

BitField.name: SCR
BitField.description: Serial Clock Rate. The number of prescaler output clocks per bit on the bus, minus one. Given that CPSDVSR is the prescale divider, and the APB clock PCLK clocks the prescaler, the bit frequency is PCLK / (CPSDVSR X [SCR+1]).

Register.name: CR1
Register.description: Control Register 1. Selects master/slave and other modes.

BitField.name: LBM
BitField.description: Loop Back Mode.

Enum.name: LOOPBACK
Enum.description: Serial input is taken from the serial output (MOSI or MISO) rather than the serial input pin (MISO or MOSI respectively).

BitField.name: SSE
BitField.description: SPI Enable.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: The SPI controller will interact with other devices on the serial bus. Software should write the appropriate control information to the other SPI/SSP registers and interrupt controller registers, before setting this bit.

BitField.name: MS
BitField.description: Master/Slave Mode.This bit can only be written when the SSE bit is 0.

Enum.name: MASTER
Enum.description: The SPI controller acts as a master on the bus, driving the SCLK, MOSI, and SSEL lines and receiving the MISO line.

Enum.name: SLAVE
Enum.description: The SPI controller acts as a slave on the bus, driving MISO line and receiving SCLK, MOSI, and SSEL lines.

BitField.name: SOD
BitField.description: Slave Output Disable. This bit is relevant only in slave mode (MS = 1). If it is 1, this blocks this SPI controller from driving the transmit data line (MISO).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: DR
Register.description: Data Register. Writes fill the transmit FIFO, and reads empty the receive FIFO.

BitField.name: DATA
BitField.description: Write: software can write data to be sent in a future frame to this register whenever the TNF bit in the Status register is 1, indicating that the Tx FIFO is not full. If the Tx FIFO was previously empty and the SPI controller is not busy on the bus, transmission of the data will begin immediately. Otherwise the data written to this register will be sent as soon as all previous data has been sent (and received). If the data length is less than 16 bit, software must right-justify the data written to this register. Read: software can read data from this register whenever the RNE bit in the Status register is 1, indicating that the Rx FIFO is not empty. When software reads this register, the SPI controller returns data from the least recent frame in the Rx FIFO. If the data length is less than 16 bit, the data is right-justified in this field with higher order bits filled with 0s.

Register.name: SR
Register.description: Status Register

BitField.name: TFE
BitField.description: Transmit FIFO Empty. This bit is 1 is the Transmit FIFO is empty, 0 if not.

BitField.name: TNF
BitField.description: Transmit FIFO Not Full. This bit is 0 if the Tx FIFO is full, 1 if not.

BitField.name: RNE
BitField.description: Receive FIFO Not Empty. This bit is 0 if the Receive FIFO is empty, 1 if not.

BitField.name: RFF
BitField.description: Receive FIFO Full. This bit is 1 if the Receive FIFO is full, 0 if not.

BitField.name: BSY
BitField.description: Busy. This bit is 0 if the SPI controller is idle, 1 if it is currently sending/receiving a frame and/or the Tx FIFO is not empty.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: CPSR
Register.description: Clock Prescale Register

BitField.name: CPSDVSR
BitField.description: This even value between 2 and 254, by which SPI_PCLK is divided to yield the prescaler output clock. Bit 0 always reads as 0.

Register.name: IMSC
Register.description: Interrupt Mask Set and Clear Register

BitField.name: RORIM
BitField.description: Software should set this bit to enable interrupt when a Receive Overrun occurs, that is, when the Rx FIFO is full and another frame is completely received. The ARM spec implies that the preceding frame data is overwritten by the new frame data when this occurs.

BitField.name: RTIM
BitField.description: Software should set this bit to enable interrupt when a Receive Time-out condition occurs. A Receive Time-out occurs when the Rx FIFO is not empty, and no has not been read for a time-out period. The time-out period is the same for master and slave modes and is determined by the SSP bit rate: 32 bits at PCLK / (CPSDVSR x [SCR+1]).

BitField.name: RXIM
BitField.description: Software should set this bit to enable interrupt when the Rx FIFO is at least half full.

BitField.name: TXIM
BitField.description: Software should set this bit to enable interrupt when the Tx FIFO is at least half empty.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: RIS
Register.description: Raw Interrupt Status Register

BitField.name: RORRIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if another frame was completely received while the RxFIFO was full. The ARM spec implies that the preceding frame data is overwritten by the new frame data when this occurs.

BitField.name: RTRIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if the Rx FIFO is not empty, and has not been read for a time-out period. The time-out period is the same for master and slave modes and is determined by the SSP bit rate: 32 bits at PCLK / (CPSDVSR x [SCR+1]).

BitField.name: RXRIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if the Rx FIFO is at least half full.

BitField.name: TXRIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if the Tx FIFO is at least half empty.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: MIS
Register.description: Masked Interrupt Status Register

BitField.name: RORMIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if another frame was completely received while the RxFIFO was full, and this interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: RTMIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if the Rx FIFO is not empty, has not been read for a time-out period, and this interrupt is enabled. The time-out period is the same for master and slave modes and is determined by the SSP bit rate: 32 bits at PCLK / (CPSDVSR x [SCR+1]).

BitField.name: RXMIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if the Rx FIFO is at least half full, and this interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: TXMIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if the Tx FIFO is at least half empty, and this interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: ICR
Register.description: SSPICR Interrupt Clear Register

BitField.name: RORIC
BitField.description: Writing a 1 to this bit clears the frame was received when RxFIFO was full interrupt.

BitField.name: RTIC
BitField.description: Writing a 1 to this bit clears the Rx FIFO was not empty and has not been read for a timeout period interrupt. The timeout period is the same for master and slave modes and is determined by the SSP bit rate: 32 bits at PCLK / (CPSDVSR x [SCR+1]).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: IC
Register.description: Interrupt clear register for port n

BitField.name: CLR0
BitField.description: Selects interrupt on pin x to be cleared (x = 0 to 11). Clears the interrupt edge detection logic. This register is write-only. The synchronizer between the GPIO and the NVIC blocks causes a delay of 2 clocks. It is recommended to add two NOPs after the clear of the interrupt edge detection logic before the exit of the interrupt service routine. 0 = No effect. 1 = Clears edge detection logic for pin PIOn_x.

Register.name: IC
Register.description: Interrupt clear register for port n

BitField.name: CLR0
BitField.description: Selects interrupt on pin x to be cleared (x = 0 to 11). Clears the interrupt edge detection logic. This register is write-only. The synchronizer between the GPIO and the NVIC blocks causes a delay of 2 clocks. It is recommended to add two NOPs after the clear of the interrupt edge detection logic before the exit of the interrupt service routine. 0 = No effect. 1 = Clears edge detection logic for pin PIOn_x.

Register.name: IC
Register.description: Interrupt clear register for port n

BitField.name: CLR0
BitField.description: Selects interrupt on pin x to be cleared (x = 0 to 11). Clears the interrupt edge detection logic. This register is write-only. The synchronizer between the GPIO and the NVIC blocks causes a delay of 2 clocks. It is recommended to add two NOPs after the clear of the interrupt edge detection logic before the exit of the interrupt service routine. 0 = No effect. 1 = Clears edge detection logic for pin PIOn_x.

Register.name: MIS
Register.description: Masked interrupt status register for port n

BitField.name: MASK0
BitField.description: Selects interrupt on pin x to be masked (x = 0 to 11). 0 = No interrupt or interrupt masked on pin PIOn_x. 1 = Interrupt on PIOn_x.

Register.name: IC
Register.description: Interrupt clear register for port n

BitField.name: CLR0
BitField.description: Selects interrupt on pin x to be cleared (x = 0 to 11). Clears the interrupt edge detection logic. This register is write-only. The synchronizer between the GPIO and the NVIC blocks causes a delay of 2 clocks. It is recommended to add two NOPs after the clear of the interrupt edge detection logic before the exit of the interrupt service routine. 0 = No effect. 1 = Clears edge detection logic for pin PIOn_x.
